highlight.name: 93cc5a65-6f78-aa35-9b0f-ead7bae183b0
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: programmer creates with an editor and saves in a text ﬁle called hello.c.

highlight.name: 22c7ee81-6cd1-9430-5cee-b2f3618fb1d3
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: The source program is a sequence of bits, each with a value of 0 or 1, organized in 8-bit chunks called bytes.

highlight.name: 57f89ad9-2df6-5a3e-c11a-cad2647d49a0
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: Each byte represents some text character in the program.

highlight.name: a1832d17-219c-be79-f551-f12b8d22e102
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: Most computer systems represent text characters using the ASCII standard that represents each character with a unique byte-size integer value.

highlight.name: a8470845-7f89-562d-1e23-84f5d48863fb
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: The hello.c program is stored in a ﬁle as a sequence of bytes.

highlight.name: 67f6365b-2d92-c5fb-f761-09ba4236f1cb
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: Files such as hello.c that consist exclusively of ASCII characters are known as text ﬁles. All other ﬁles are known as binary ﬁles.

highlight.name: 6a6b6e5c-4389-89d9-3462-91e8d6e4574f
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: All information in a system—including disk ﬁles, programs stored in memory, user data stored in memory, and data transferred across a network—is represented as a bunch of bits.

highlight.name: 027bb5cf-8073-8f8f-ea98-fc37dbec629c
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: in different contexts, the same sequence of bytes might represent an integer, ﬂoating-point number, character string, or machine instruction.

highlight.name: ce3b184b-166b-4d1a-36c4-eabd298f44dc
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: Running throughout the system is a collection of electrical conduits called buses that carry bytes of information back and forth between the components.

highlight.name: 61df0fcc-5ef4-665b-05fd-57521377882c
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: Buses are typically designed to transfer ﬁxed-size chunks of bytes known as words.The number of bytes in a word (the word size) is a fundamental system parameter that varies across systems. Most machines today have word sizes of either 4 bytes (32 bits) or 8 bytes (64 bits).

highlight.name: dbae7a69-a334-35aa-3e11-cd98207b3cda
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: EachI/O device is connected to the I/O busby either a controller or an adapter.

highlight.name: 378c888a-6432-f359-6bcf-7079bd12830e
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: Regardless, the purpose of each is to transfer information back and forth between the I/O bus and an I/O device.

highlight.name: 32e13738-863b-5ad2-fb55-66cab7340bab
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: Physically, mainmemory consists ofa collection ofdynamic random access memory(DRAM) chips. Logically, memory is organized as a linear array of bytes, each with its own unique address (array index) starting at zero.

highlight.name: 1c9c5ab8-bb4a-2039-f4bc-476ab8915fe6
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: Initially, the shell program is executing its instructions, waiting for us to type a command. As we type the characters ./hello at the keyboard, the shell program reads each one into a register and then stores it in memory

highlight.name: 89fd9eb0-b6de-bcb4-c8e4-6c65349dde87
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: When we hit the enter key on the keyboard, the shell knows that we have ﬁnished typing the command.

highlight.name: 8bb95146-9457-f353-3f0e-7060b982e716
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: The data includes the string of characters hello, world\n that will eventually be printed out.

highlight.name: 45a475da-faf1-d9ec-0aa6-f52d837410f2
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: Using a technique known as direct memory access (DMA, discussed in Chap- ter 6), the data travel directly from disk to main memory, without passing through the processor.

highlight.name: a97da219-9f95-9685-b539-bc16d0ad0190
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: Once the code and data in the hello object ﬁle are loaded into memory, the processor begins executing the machine-language instructions in the hello program’s main routine.

highlight.name: 41d7aa2c-e67b-28bd-18e4-22cdee6e14ac
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: These instructions copy the bytes in the hello, world\n string from memory to the register ﬁle, and from there to the display device, where they are displayed on the screen.

highlight.name: 5b65e0bc-7438-dec2-3be6-61e40ea0dccd
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: Rather than accessing individual bits in memory, most computers use blocks of 8 bits, or bytes, as the smallest addressable unit of memory. A machine-level program views memory as a very large array of bytes, referred to as virtual memory. Every byte of memory is identiﬁed by a unique number, known as its address, and the set of all possible addresses is known as the virtual address space.

highlight.name: bf67ca9f-1f50-840f-8cc7-e3eeb5026c65
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: data produced by a little-endian machine to be sent to a big-endian machine,

highlight.name: 69b3357b-b875-ec02-3fd3-032eb1c57438
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: To avoid such problems, code written for networking applications must follow established conventions for byte order- ing to make sure the sending machine converts its internal representation to the network standard, while the receiving machine converts the network standard to its internal representation.

highlight.name: dc5ad5f2-7286-260e-a005-cec0e32f2057
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: For program objects that span multiple bytes, we must establish two conventions: what the address of the object will be, and how we will order the bytes in memory.

highlight.name: 10b39d94-0196-139c-bb1d-cc9ea76d5cc3
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: In virtually all machines, a multi-byte object is stored as a contiguous sequence of bytes, with the address of the object given by the smallest address of the bytes used. For example, suppose a variable x of type int has address 0x100; that is, the value of the address expression &x is 0x100. Then (assuming data type int has a 32-bit representation) the 4 bytes of x would be stored in memory locations 0x100, 0x101, 0x102, and 0x103.

highlight.name: 47b3982a-0dd9-9be7-4885-ffdb0caf5930
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: For ordering the bytes representing an object, there are two common conven- tions.

highlight.name: 41136916-5083-d515-60b9-2de8aa159f56
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: the least signiﬁcant byte comes ﬁrst—is referred to as little endian.

highlight.name: b88e00cb-4f75-27c7-2bc8-8302adbdbda1
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: the most signiﬁcant byte comes ﬁrst—is referred to as big endian.

highlight.name: d8cb378b-7909-4a93-19b7-6c9b0ab7e64a
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: Many recent microprocessor chips are bi-endian, meaning that they can be conﬁgured to operate as either little- or big-endian machines

highlight.name: 929f61e5-dfc4-ab56-5537-4a7698c7e7e7
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: In practice, however, byte ordering becomes ﬁxed once a particular operating system is chosen.

highlight.name: abda0dde-b899-940a-1f41-c1a7f7754d85
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: ARM microprocessors, used in many cell phones, have hardware that can operate in either little- or big-endian mode

highlight.name: c3d6de79-211c-46b1-6ff5-3a2dd7d95ae5
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: —Android (from Google) and IOS (from Apple)—operate only in little-endian mode.

highlight.name: 9e506444-3b70-2507-8757-22c98f382da5
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: A string in C is encoded by an array of characters terminated by the null (having value 0) character. Each character is represented by some standard encoding, with the most common being the ASCII character code.

highlight.name: e3a64e69-c45f-8a6a-22bf-eb82e447d2c7
highlight.title: Guest
highlight.subject: 高亮
highlight.contents: This same result would be obtained on any system using ASCII as its character code, independent of the byte ordering and word size conventions. As a consequence, text data are more platform independent than binary data.
